<h4>Description</h4>: Creating a brand new rapper into the French rap scene
<h4>Technical details</h4>:
Inspired by encore.ai
Using python for scraping the API of genius.com
Photo by Søren Astrup Jørgensen on Unsplash

<h4>Description</h4>: During the 2019 edition of the Scaleday, celebrating Scaleway's 20-year anniversary, I had the opportunity to present my work.
I designed and built a machine learning pipeline to prevent credit card fraud on Scaleway, an prevent fraudsters to create accounts on the platform and steal resources.
<h4>Technical details</h4>: After a lot of feature engineering, I used CatBoost's gradient-boosting algorithm to make the final predictions.
The presentation is hosted on Scaleway's slideshare account.

title: Artificial Intelligence Meetup
subtitle: Open-Source Tools for Machine Learning on Kubernetes

<h4>Description</h4>: Kubernetes has become the go-to tool to deploy, scale & manage distributed apps.
As Machine Learning find its way into more apps, it’s imperative to take advantage of Kubernetes infrastructure to develop more distributed and scalable models.
In this talk, we will show you some open source frameworks that you can use to create a full Machine Learning pipeline, from training to inference.
<h4>Technical details</h4>: See the Meetup description on the Meetup website.

title: Talk - RAPIDS.ai
subtitle: Leveraging GPUs for accelerated data science & data analytics

<h4>Description</h4>: RAPIDS makes it possible to have end-to-end data science pipelines run entirely on GPU architecture. It capitalizes on the parallelization capabilities of GPUs to accelerate data preprocessing pipelines, with a pandas-like dataframe syntax. GPU-optimized versions of scikit-learn algorithms are available, and RAPIDS also integrates with major deep learning frameworks. This talk will present RAPIDS and its capabilities, and how to integrate it in your pipelines.
<h4>More info</h4>: I have done this talk at two meetups, in Paris:

- PyData Paris Meetup: PyData Paris - October 3rd Meetup.
More info about the PyData organization and what they do: pydata.org.

- Paris Machine Learning Applications Meetup: S7 E2, Symbolic maths/GAN/Transportation/Retail/Rapids.ai.
More info about the organizer, Igor Carron: nuit-blanche blog.
The notebooks I made for benchmarking RAPIDS for the Meetup are on my personal GitHub.
